title: WATCH — I met YouTuber Lilly Singh
text:
Superwoman set to launch new NBC TV show

Lilly Singh's mantra is “hustle harder” — and she seems to be living up to that philosophy these days.

The 30-year-old Canadian, who built her career on YouTube, launches her new TV show A Little Late With Lilly Singh tonight on NBC.

Mindy Kaling, Kenan Thompson, Tracee Ellis Ross and Chelsea Handler are the debut week guests, with Rainn Wilson also making an appearance.

Singh is the first openly bisexual woman of colour to host a late night show.

She’s also the first Indo-Canadian personality to leap from YouTube to a major television network.

Singh started her YouTube channel in 2010 with "Superwoman" as her nickname.

She produced comedy sketches and vlogs out of her bedroom in Scarborough, Ont.

Her first video to surpass 10,000 views was Official Guide to Brown Girls.

This 11-minute comedy bit was about Indian women and the men who woo them.

After its success, she put even more energy into her IISuperwomanII channel.

Since then Singh has accomplished personal and industry bests, including:

Almost 15 million subscribers and three billion video views on YouTube.

Author of a New York Times business bestseller: How To Be a Bawse: A Guide to Conquering Life.

Founder of #GirlLove, which is an initiative aimed at breaking the cycle of girl-on-girl hate and encouraging women to build each other up.

Won a 2017 People's Choice Award for favourite YouTube star.

Ranked No. 10 on the Forbes list of the world's highest-paid YouTube stars in 2017.

Collaborated with Will Smith, Dwayne (The Rock) Johnson and Selena Gomez for videos on her channel.

Singh also recently launched a clothing line with Quebec-owned Ardene.

She lives in Los Angeles, but made it back home to Ontario for a meet-and-greet with fans before her NBC show premiere and to promote her collaboration with Ardene.

Myah Elliott, the host of RECAP — a news recap show powered by CBC Kids News that launches Oct. 4 — wanted to experience the hype around YouTuber meet-and-greets.

So she woke up extra early and planted herself firmly at the front of the line at Bramalea City Centre mall in Brampton on Sept. 7.

Leaving your spot in line to go to the bathroom means losing your spot in line.

#RIPbladder

Watch her storytime video to experience all the highs (the retweet incident) and the lows (no vlogging).

Including the big moment.

Yes, Myah got her selfie with Superwoman!

Hours of waiting for just 10 seconds with Lilly — before she moves on to become an even bigger superstar.

A Little Late with Lilly Singh will replace Last Call with Carson Daly in its 1:35 a.m. ET/PT time slot and follows The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon and Late Night with Seth Meyers.

Oh, and don't worry. Since you probably won't be awake when A Little Late airs — there's a YouTube channel for that.
description: What it was like to meet YouTuber Lilly Singh, a.k.a. Superwoman, at a fan event before the launch of her new NBC TV show.
